vulnerabilities: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
description: The provided code is vulnerable to both CWE-20 (Improper Input Validation) and CWE-116 (Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command). The code does not properly validate the input parameter 'param' before using it to construct a key-value pair. This can lead to various vulnerabilities, including SQL injection if the resulting key-value pair is used in an SQL command. Additionally, the code does not properly handle quoted values, allowing an attacker to manipulate the value by including quotes in the input.
